I've argued with a lot of people about extra-terrestrial races and their supposed travel to this planet. My arguments have always been two fold: 1. The laws of physics coupled with the great distances and immense difficulties navigating in space suggests that travel in deep space is extremely unlikely for any intelligent race. 2. Even if some race has found some kind of "loophole" in physics that we don't yet know about, the extreme amount of energy and resources such travel would require makes that travel improbable. Why would any intelligent race expend such great quantities of resources to come here and play cat and mouse with us?
If UFOs wanted to keep secret, you'd think they would be intelligent enough not to turn on colored blinking lights.

They coroborated what my mother had told me without my describing the object or the incident in detail until after they had started discussing the triangular object. This was back in 1963,and what they told me matched my mother's recollection. I have no reason to doubt they are extraterrestrial in origin.

Worth looking up before you totally freak out about the alien invasion. Once, a few years back, I was sitting on my veranda enjoying the cool night air. As I looked out into the night sky I saw an oval shaped ‚Äúobject‚Äù with an odd uniform glow that seemed to be coming from inside. It was moving very slowly but steadily far enough away to move behind large trees far off in the distance. It was heading north and I sat watching it with my wife for about 2-3 minutes until it finally went behind a large stand of trees then never came out from behind those trees again... at least we didn‚Äôt see it re-emerge. So we sorta sat back down (we had stood up to move to the railing for a better look trying to make sense of what we had seen). She‚Äôs a total nonbeliever but I try to keep an open mind on things I may not fully understand. At any rate, as we were back in our chairs thinking ‚Äúit‚Äù was gone, I saw the exact same object appear in the exact same place moving south to north just as it had the first time. THIS is where it really got weird. We both stood up and went back to the upper veranda railing to watch this identical thing go through the identical motions until it‚Äôs position reach directly parallel to where I was standing. Again, same distance, same glow, same shape, same everything.All was as before. Suddenly, I recalled a tv show I‚Äôd seen years before about how it‚Äôs thought by some that if aliens exist they were said to communicate by way of mental telepathy. Then I had a thought pop into my mind that I could try that, ‚Äúthat‚Äù being my focusing my attention on trying to connect with any intelligent form of life or AI that might be aboard. Sounds crazy, I know. BUT, the instant that notion came to me & I did focus as I described, that thing did a 90 degree turn in our direction. But it didn‚Äôt do like a plane would‚Äôve with a slow bank to the west toward us... no, I mean it turned instantly like |___ a full 90 degrees with no loss of speed (& remember, it wasn‚Äôt moving quickly at the time we first saw it in the distance)  and headed directly for us. I don‚Äôt let myself get rattled easily and my wife, who was a total skeptic, suddenly had nothing to say... it scared her so much. Truthfully, I wasn‚Äôt saying much either because though it was far away when we spotted it and moving, well, as I said, it seemed slow to us. As soon as I felt the weird connection that I was trying to make. It was now just across the road in front of our house. It only took two seconds before it was, like, literally moving toward us and was, I thought, going to pass right over us and our house. But it didn‚Äôt. Just as it got to the far edge of the road in front where we were, it turned again & flew due south. And just like the first time I saw it change direction and head for us, it did the exact same maneuver turning on a dime exactly as it turned toward us the first time & I was just awestruck. My wife was speechless & she isn‚Äôt often speechless. The thing made virtually no sound... if anything it was a soft swish. So I stuck my head forward as far as I could w/o putting a hole in the screen trying to get a good look. What I saw I can‚Äôt adequately say but it looked like large rectangular fins were opening and closing. I thought it might‚Äôve been birds... but I don‚Äôt think it was. I don‚Äôt know what it was. But it did beeline it straight for us then grew in size & turned just before it reached our house. We approached a intersection that had a stop sign but before we got there about a mile or so all of a sudden there was a bright intense white light above us. We trued to look out the car windows to figure out what it was but couldn‚Äôt because of the brightness of the light. But be of good cheer. If a species living near the center of our galaxy decided to toodle on out and see what was doing in our neck of the woods, and left about 5,000 B.C., traveling at the speed of light (720 million miles per hour), they won't get here for another 23,000 years.

I'm tired of these clowns obsessing over grainy footage of visual artefacts, exhaust flames and birds, insisting that IT MUST BE ALIENS!! when there is a real project to find intelligent life -- SETI -- and it is pathetically underfunded.

Out there in our galaxy is where we'll find evident of intelligent civilizations. We finally got dedicated radio telescopes on the search (the Allen Array) but we could be doing so much more, looking for more advanced methods of communication, looking for evidence of megastructures like Dyson spheres, searching for the energy signatures that would mark Type I and II civilizations.

There is absolutely no reason for an interstellar civilization to take an interest in us and travel here, and even if we were interesting to them, unless there's an intelligent alien civilization right on our doorstep, there hasn't even been enough time for a potentially curious civilization to intercept our decaying signals and make the journey here.

You would think UFO enthusiasts would understand that, but most of them don't seem to have any concept of how massive and old our galaxy is. So instead of donating to SETI and/or turning their efforts toward assisting serious searches, they obsess over visual artefacts in low-resolution footage.
Somehow, I think the first encounter with aliens will be more like "Mars Attacks" and less like "Close encounters of the 3rd kind".

If this were OUR technology, the most likely response would be either confirmation or silence.  Saying we (i.e., United States) don't know, would not only be a lie if this were true, but most importantly, it wouldn't achieve anything.  If we KNOW it's another country's or even have a REMOTE concern that it's another country's technology, we would remain silent and continue to secretly evaluate. We certainly wouldn't ADMIT we don't know. That would embolden our adversaries and give them a reason to challenge us.  I believe we truly have ruled out the latter alternative. What we've seen isn't just considerably beyond any current capabilities, we can't even imagine what it is. Our military and scientific institutions would certainly know if there was even a remote chance it's from, say, China or Russia.  No, there is much more to this communication than just a simple admission of ignorance.
